title: Salmon Cakes

binders_and_fillers: 1 cup panko breadcrumbs or Japanese-style breadcrumbs

steps: Discard the salmon skin, flake the salmon with a fork, and remove any bones if needed.
Bring a medium skillet to medium heat.
Add 1 Tbsp olive oil and 1 Tbsp butter to the skillet.
Add the onion and red bell pepper.
Sauté for 7 to 9 minutes, or until softened and golden.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flaked salmon, onion and bell pepper mixture, breadcrumbs, eggs, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, black pepper, and parsley.
Form the mixture into 13 or 14 patties that are 1/3 inch to 1/2 inch thick.
Heat 1 Tbsp olive oil and 1 Tbsp butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Once the butter is sizzling, add half of the salmon cakes and sauté for 3 1/2 to 4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through (reduce heat if browning too quickly).
Add remaining 1 Tbsp olive oil and 1 Tbsp butter and cook the remaining salmon cakes.
